summary: [Question] Regular table salt without dextrose in it? via /r/Paleo
title: [Question] Regular table salt without dextrose in it? via /r/Paleo
body:
Horrified to find out that Morton table salt has dextrose in it. Normally I just use Himalayan pink salt on all my food but I like to use Morton if I need salt for a huge pot of soup or something (easier than grinding for 15 min.) Any salt recommendations without sugar/dextrose that come in a hefty container like that?

Thanks so much in advance!



Submitted September 15, 2018 at 06:37AM by kanukia
via reddit https://ift.tt/2xf1VbD

title: Gouty Arthritis with Fever
body:
Since gouty arthritis is caused by high uric acid levels that product uric acid crystals around a joint, your body’s immune system will try to resolve that on its own.

Gouty Arthritis with Fever

summary: HCSM News ~ Timing is everything: How body-clock medicine tackles age-old diseases
title: HCSM News ~ Timing is everything: How body-clock medicine tackles age-old diseases
body:
Discoveries about what makes our internal clocks tick could create new treatments for conditions like epilepsy, diabetes and heart disease.



Read more from CBC https://www.cbc.ca/news/health/second-opinion-body-clocks-1.4824353?cmp=rss

summary:
Flu PREVENTION season is here.
Your best defense is against the flu is ramping up your immune system with 
elderberry syrup,...
caption:
Flu PREVENTION season is here.
Your best defense is against the flu is ramping up your immune system with
elderberry syrup, which can actually work better than OTC meds in shortening the duration of viruses. Scientific studies show that elderberry prevents viruses from replicating in the body, shortening the duration of colds or flu. During flu season I use elderberry syrup as a favouring in our water bottles – 1 teaspoon per cup of water.
Black Elderberry syrup

Yield: 2 cups
½ cup dried elderberries
½ cup dried yarrow leaves and flowers (optional)
Juice from a 2 inch piece of raw organic ginger root (optional)
3 cups of filtered water
1 cup of raw local honey

Simmer the elderberries, yarrow and filtered water together in a covered pan for 30 minutes. Mash the elderberries with a potato masher. Strain them through a sieve, reserve the elderberry juice. To make ginger juice, cut the piece of ginger into ½ inch pieces and squeeze through a garlic press, catching the juice in a small container. Add raw ginger juice to the hot elderberry syrup. Add 1 cup of raw honey and stir thoroughly to incorporate the honey, without heating again. Allow the syrup to cool.

Yarrow makes you sweat (diaphoretic) and tricks your body into fighting the virus, even before it’s taken hold. It’s also beneficial for the lungs, which I find helpful during a cold.
The yarrow gives the syrup a faint medicinal taste, but it isn’t over powering, yet it is still warming.
Take 1-2 T every 3-4 hrs to shorten cold and daily to prevent.
Recipe curtosey of Joybille Farm.
….
#fluseason #herbalremedies #wellness #health #fitness #nutrition #gym #healthy #love #healthylifestyle #lifestyle #motivation #selfcare #selflove #fitfam #fitnessmotivation #workout #wellbeing #instagood #vegan #muscle #exercise #healthyliving #yoga #organic #mentalhealth #healthylife #mindfulness #fit #positivevibes
https://www.instagram.com/p/BnqsGViF7u5/?utm_source=ig_tumblr_share&igshid=z6rs2uupt2qj

summary: Suspending young students risks future success in school
title: Suspending young students risks future success in school
body:
These young suspended students — especially boys — are likely to be suspended again later in elementary school, according to Zibei Chen, a research fellow at the U-M School of Social Work, and colleagues at Louisiana State University. Schools often use suspensions to discipline… eCommerce web development
